programme.desc: Staff at Auckland Airport meet a Greek man with no money but a rich history, while Customs find jeans with more than just dodgy labels to hide. (S11, ep 9)

programme.title: Border Patrol
programme.desc: Customs deal with a Lithuanian man who has very questionable holiday plans and a risky item lands at the International Mail Centre. (S11, ep 10)

programme.title: Nothing To Declare
programme.desc: Cameras join officers from Australia's airports, harbours and mail services as they protect the nation from drug-smugglers, illegal products and unusual creepy-crawlies. (S8, ep 10)

programme.title: Nothing To Declare
programme.desc: Documentary series following Australian Customs and Border Protection officers as they attempt to enforce the country's customs, quarantine and immigration laws. (S9, ep 1)

programme.title: Nothing To Declare
programme.desc: Documentary series following Australian Customs and Border Protection officers as they attempt to enforce the country's customs, quarantine and immigration laws. (S14, ep 12)

programme.desc: Documentary series following Australian Customs and Border Protection officers as they attempt to enforce the country's customs, quarantine and immigration laws. (S14, ep 13)

programme.title: Star Trek: Enterprise
programme.desc: Bounty: After exploring an uninhabited planet, Captain Archer is taken prisoner by a Tellarite bounty hunter who was hired by the Klingons to return Archer to Qo'noS. (S2, ep 25)

programme.title: Stargate SG-1
programme.desc: Meridian: In a moving episode, Jackson makes the ultimate sacrifice to save a race of people who would otherwise die. His exposure to radiation seems fatal. Can Ona Desala help? (S5, ep 21)

programme.title: Stargate Universe
programme.desc: Malice: Blood is spilled when Simeon makes his escape, sending Rush on a vengeful mission. Hot in pursuit are Young and Greer, who must bring Simeon back unharmed. (S2, ep 8)

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
programme.desc: 11001001: Members of an alien species known as the Bynars take over the Enterprise's computer when their own planet's equipment falters. (S1, ep 15)

programme.title: Star Trek: Deep Space Nine
programme.desc: Tribunal: O'Brien must visit Cardassia Prime to attend a trial when he is accused of committing a crime. But what crime he has committed, no one will say. (S2, ep 25)

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: Payback: The team try to figure out a motive when the son of a retired FBI agent is kidnapped. Also, Isobel has a hard decision to make. (S2, ep 13)

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: Studio Gangster: The team must piece together what happened when an attorney is found dead near the body of a private escort. (S2, ep 14)

programme.title: Grimm
programme.desc: Iron Hans: Nick and Hank discover their latest investigation is related to a deadly, age-old Wesen rite of passage. (S4, ep 19)

programme.title: Tour de France Highlights
programme.desc: Action from the 13th stage, a 10.9km individual time-trial from Loudenvielle to Peyragudes. Gary Imlach presents, with analysis from Pete Kennaugh, commentary by Ned Boulting and David Millar, and interviews from reporters Daniel Friebe and Matt Rendell

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Katie Piper's Weekend Escape
programme.desc: Katie is joined by Steps' Lee Latchford-Evans to make a mini allotment, hairdresser Michael Douglas and make-up artist Genevieve Turley transform another charity founder, and JJ Goodman serves up more delicious drinks

programme.title: Ainsley's Food We Love
programme.desc: The chef prepares a selection of dishes perfect for al fresco dining, including Cypriot lamb chops, cherry tomato skewers and potato salad. Supper Club host Joseph Denison Carey serves up a tagliatelle, and Ainsley shows guest Dev Griffin how to make sesame and singer seabass with an Asian noodles salad. Olly Smith has canned drinks perfect for the great outdoors

programme.title: Tomorrow Never Dies
programme.desc: Spy adventure starring Pierce Brosnan, Jonathan Pryce and Michelle Yeoh. Intending to reap the profits of increased ratings for his global multimedia empire, Elliot Carver attempts to ignite a conflict between Britain and China by sinking a British frigate and shooting down a Chinese fighter plane. The British Secret Service sends James Bond to verify suspicions that Carver is behind the incident.

programme.title: Jimmy & Shivi's Farmhouse Breakfast
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty and Shivi Ramoutar's guest is singer Chesney Hawkes, with Shivi serving up smashed breakfast tacos and drinks expert Andy Clarke joins the gang for a tequila tasting. Jimmy checks in on the snakes at the wildlife park to make sure that they're growing properly, and Max McMurdo makes a handy bread-slicing device

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is joined at his Hampshire home this time by singer-songwriter Jack Savoretti, Midsomer Murders star Neil Dudgeon, and chefs Glynn Purnell and Sabrina Gidda.

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: John Torode and Lisa Faulkner make four mouth-watering dishes with only five main ingredients, starting with a garlic and rosemary focaccia, followed by John's pink spaghetti. Following that are chicken and peanut butter scissor-cut noodles and moreish and fuss-free banana doughnuts.

programme.title: Raymond Blanc's Royal Kitchen Gardens
programme.desc: The chef returns to Highgrove House in Gloucestershire, the family residence of King Charles and Queen Camilla. Mel takes him around some of their vegetable beds while chatting about how she came to be a gardener for the King, while royal beekeeper Stephen demonstrates the art of managing hives as he and Raymond discuss their shared passion for bees and honey

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: STV Racing: Live from Newbury
programme.desc: Oli Bell presents coverage of a meeting headlined by the Super Sprint from Newbury, plus racing from Market Rasen and The Curragh. With analysis from Leonna Mayor and Mick Fitzgerald, reports by Matt Chapman, Sally Ann Grassick and Luke Harvey, and commentary from Mark Johnson

programme.title: Tipping Point: Best Ever Finals
programme.desc: Two more of the most dramatic endgames from the arcade-themed quiz show hosted by Ben Shephard, in which the last contestant standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Toby Anstis, Paula Radcliffe, Rav Wilding and Vanessa Feltz pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: Shark! Celebrity Infested Waters
programme.desc: Lenny Henry, Lucy Punch, Helen George, Rachel Riley, Ade Adepitan, Dougie Poynter and Ross Noble head to the Bahamas to swim with man-eating sharks. Experts Danni Washington and Tristan Guttridge and shark attack survivor Paul de Gelder are the mentors whose mission is to help the celebrities conquer their fears and teach them to love this notorious predator

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: UEFA Women's Euro 2025
programme.desc: France v Germany (Kick-off 8.00pm). All the action from the fourth and concluding quarter-final, held at St. Jakob-Park in Basel, Switzerland. France finished top of Group D after winning all three of their group matches, including a 2-1 victory over holders England. Their opponents finished second in Group C after defeating Poland and Denmark, but suffering a 4-1 defeat at the hands of table-toppers Sweden last time out

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Suspicion
programme.desc: Hiding in a country cottage, the five suspects attempt to uncover who framed them-or who among them is guilty.

programme.title: Tour de France Highlights
programme.desc: Action from stage 14, which consisted of a 182.6km route from Pau to the ski resort of Luchon-Superbagnres. Gary Imlach presents, with analysis from Pete Kennaugh, commentary by Ned Boulting and David Millar, and interviews from reporters Daniel Friebe and Matt Rendell

programme.title: The Twelve
programme.desc: As the jury is selected for Kate Lawson's lengthy trial, the Press follows the sensational case of her missing 14-year-old niece Claire Spears, who is presumed murdered. When the jurors meet for the first time, it's clear that this is a diverse group who bring their own problems to the table. Australian courtroom drama, starring Sam Neill and Kate Mulvany

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Shark! Celebrity Infested Waters
programme.desc: Lenny Henry, Lucy Punch, Helen George, Rachel Riley, Ade Adepitan, Dougie Poynter and Ross Noble head to the Bahamas to swim with man-eating sharks. Experts Danni Washington and Tristan Guttridge and shark attack survivor Paul de Gelder are the mentors whose mission is to help the celebrities conquer their fears and teach them to love this notorious predator

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: John Torode and Lisa Faulkner make four mouth-watering dishes with only five main ingredients, starting with a garlic and rosemary focaccia, followed by John's pink spaghetti. Following that are chicken and peanut butter scissor-cut noodles and moreish and fuss-free banana doughnuts.

programme.title: Flushed Away
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure featuring the voices of Hugh Jackman, Kate Winslet and Ian McKellen. Posh rodent Roddy St James leads a sheltered life in a Kensington mansion, with his every need catered for by his wealthy owners. But his life as a pampered pet comes to an end when he's flushed down the toilet to a subterranean world where the population is being threatened by an evil toad.

programme.title: Katie Piper's Weekend Escape
programme.desc: Katie is joined by Steps' Lee Latchford-Evans to make a mini allotment, hairdresser Michael Douglas and make-up artist Genevieve Turley transform a supportive sister, and JJ Goodman serves up more delicious drinks

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Joining Alan to provide the chat this time are Selina Scott, Pixie Lott and Tom Parker-Bowles, and we also meet some rare-breed Guernsey goats with a royal title.

programme.title: Ninja Warrior UK
programme.desc: Competitors from across the nation test their strength, speed and courage in this obstacle-course challenge, with celebrity contestants including professional skater Sylvain Longchambon, singer Joe McElderry, and Olympian snowboarder Aimee Fuller competing alongside members of the public. Hosted by Ben Shephard, Rochelle Humes and Chris Kamara

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Mrs Doubtfire
programme.desc: Comedy drama starring Robin Williams, Sally Field and Pierce Brosnan. When voiceover artist Daniel Hillard walks out of his day job, his wife Miranda decides it's time to walk out on him, and is granted custody of their children. Daniel is desperate to be with his kids, so when Miranda advertises for a nanny-cum-housekeeper he applies for the job in disguise.

programme.title: The Spy Who Loved Me
programme.desc: Spy adventure starring Roger Moore and Barbara Bach. James Bond sets out to stop an evil shipping magnate who is capturing nuclear submarines by means of a secret tracking device. Bond finds help in the unlikely shape of a beautiful KGB agent, and a formidable enemy in steel-toothed killer Jaws.

programme.title: Sean's Scotland
programme.desc: Sean travels to Perth and Kinross, visiting Loch of the Lowes Visitor Centre and Wildlife Reserve to learn about the ospreys that return there to mate

programme.title: The People's History Show
programme.desc: There is a visit to Dounreay nuclear power plant, Atta Yaqub learns about footballer-turned-writer Neil Paterson, and Jennifer Reoch finds out about the thread industry in Paisley

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Celebrity Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts as contestants Mark Bonnar, Alexandra Burke and Claire Sweeney 'see it and say it' as they try to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. After the first elimination, the two remaining players battle to reach the Super Catchphrase round, where one of them could win 50,000 for the charity of their choice

programme.title: Karen Pirie
programme.desc: Amid societal unrest in 1984, oil heiress Catriona Grant and her son Adam are kidnapped at gunpoint, but after sending two ransom notes the culprits unexpectedly fall silent and the pair are never seen again. When a man's body is discovered 40 years later in a quarry with a piece of evidence connected to the case, DI Karen Pirie is tasked with reopening the case with the first new lead in decades. Return of the crime drama based on the series of novels by Val McDermid, starring Lauren Lyle

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Breaking the Silence: Kate's Story
programme.desc: Former MP Kate Kniveton gives a frank and full insight into her experience of being abused and shamed into silence over 10 years by her ex-husband Andrew Griffiths, who was then a Conservative government minister. Kate also meets other high-achieving professional women who were secretly suffering appalling abuse behind closed doors and who, like her, felt there was no way they could escape the relationship. In this powerful documentary for the Exposure strand, Kate also sheds new light on the secretive world of the family court and shows how perpetrators can play the system to continue their abuse and how judges can get it badly wrong when it comes to protecting survivors and their children

programme.title: The Assembly
programme.desc: Footballer-turned-presenter Gary Lineker gets the grilling of a lifetime as he faces questions from autistic and learning-disabled interviewers, asking if he was forced out by the BBC and who the worst person he has worked with is. From the Hand of God to his first love, no question is off the table and no subject out of bounds when it comes to the Assembly's line of enquiry - expect revelations, chaos, and a lot of laughs

programme.title: Motorsport UK
programme.desc: Richard John Neil presents action from Snetterton featuring racing from the Wera Tools F4 British Championship and The Vertu MINI CHALLENGE.

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Tour de France Highlights
programme.desc: Action stage 15, which consisted of a 169.3km route from Muret to Carcassonne. Gary Imlach presents, with analysis from Pete Kennaugh, commentary by Ned Boulting and David Millar, and interviews from reporters Daniel Friebe and Matt Rendell

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features

programme.title: Celebrity Catchphrase

After the first elimination, the two remaining players battle to reach the Super Catchphrase round, where one of them could win 50,000 for the charity of their choice

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: This time, Sophia and her husband James from Surrey, Welsh couple Rhydian and Jamie, and junior doctor Becky and her mum Julie from Leeds try to work out words that appear in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. Presented by Adil Ray

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Mario from Ipswich, Emma originally from Barnsley, Jacqueline from Surrey and Greg from Nottingham pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Liam makes a discovery. while Robert's suspicions are piqued and Pollard tells Mack the truth

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Ryan worries about Debbie's behaviour at work, Dev absolves Aadi of any guilt for the robbery, Lou asks a massive favour of Sally, and Billy overhears Theo lying to an old friend

programme.title: Shark! Celebrity Infested Waters
programme.desc: The famous faces discover their final mission will be to swim with 18-foot tiger sharks. Ade Adepitan struggles to master his special diving equipment during a training exercise and makes a mad dash for a boat with sharks all around him. Meanwhile, Lucy Punch and Ross Noble find themselves in 'predator alley', Helen George suffers a panic attack and falls behind the team during scuba training, and the stars enjoy a spectacular coral reef dive before learning about their next encounter

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Yorkshire Ripper: The Secret Murders
programme.desc: Part one of two. Examining the police investigation into the crimes of serial killer Peter Sutcliffe, known as the Yorkshire Ripper, and the missed opportunities to charge him for his earlier, unacknowledged crimes. This episode explores the murders of Judith Roberts in 1972 and Carol Wilkinson in 1977, and the two innocent men who were mistakenly charged with their killings

programme.title: Tour de France Highlights
programme.desc: Gary Imlach presents news on the second rest day, featuring a recap of the action so far and a look ahead to forthcoming stages. With features from reporters Daniel Friebe and Matt Rendell and insight from Pete Kennaugh

programme.title: Creed II
programme.desc: Boxing drama starring Michael B Jordan and Sylvester Stallone. Three years after he began training with the legendary Rocky Balboa, Adonis "Donnie" Creed has taken the title of world heavyweight champion. When Russian fighter Viktor Drago, whose father Ivan killed Donnie's dad in the ring decades prior, challenges the young American to a show bout, Donnie and Rocky find their relationship strained. Can the pair work things out? And can Donnie find the inner strength to avenge his father?

programme.title: Tour de France Highlights
programme.desc: Action from the 13th stage, a 10.9km individual time-trial from Loudenvielle to Peyragudes. Gary Imlach presents, with analysis from Pete Kennaugh, commentary by Ned Boulting and David Millar, and interviews from reporters Daniel Friebe and Matt Rendell

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Katie Piper's Weekend Escape
programme.desc: Katie is joined by Steps' Lee Latchford-Evans to make a mini allotment, hairdresser Michael Douglas and make-up artist Genevieve Turley transform another charity founder, and JJ Goodman serves up more delicious drinks

programme.title: Ainsley's Food We Love
programme.desc: The chef prepares a selection of dishes perfect for al fresco dining, including Cypriot lamb chops, cherry tomato skewers and potato salad. Supper Club host Joseph Denison Carey serves up a tagliatelle, and Ainsley shows guest Dev Griffin how to make sesame and singer seabass with an Asian noodles salad. Olly Smith has canned drinks perfect for the great outdoors

programme.title: Tomorrow Never Dies
programme.desc: Spy adventure starring Pierce Brosnan, Jonathan Pryce and Michelle Yeoh. Intending to reap the profits of increased ratings for his global multimedia empire, Elliot Carver attempts to ignite a conflict between Britain and China by sinking a British frigate and shooting down a Chinese fighter plane. The British Secret Service sends James Bond to verify suspicions that Carver is behind the incident.

programme.title: Jimmy & Shivi's Farmhouse Breakfast
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty and Shivi Ramoutar's guest is singer Chesney Hawkes, with Shivi serving up smashed breakfast tacos and drinks expert Andy Clarke joins the gang for a tequila tasting. Jimmy checks in on the snakes at the wildlife park to make sure that they're growing properly, and Max McMurdo makes a handy bread-slicing device

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is joined at his Hampshire home this time by singer-songwriter Jack Savoretti, Midsomer Murders star Neil Dudgeon, and chefs Glynn Purnell and Sabrina Gidda.

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: John Torode and Lisa Faulkner make four mouth-watering dishes with only five main ingredients, starting with a garlic and rosemary focaccia, followed by John's pink spaghetti. Following that are chicken and peanut butter scissor-cut noodles and moreish and fuss-free banana doughnuts.

programme.title: Raymond Blanc's Royal Kitchen Gardens
programme.desc: The chef returns to Highgrove House in Gloucestershire, the family residence of King Charles and Queen Camilla. Mel takes him around some of their vegetable beds while chatting about how she came to be a gardener for the King, while royal beekeeper Stephen demonstrates the art of managing hives as he and Raymond discuss their shared passion for bees and honey

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: STV Racing: Live from Newbury
programme.desc: Oli Bell presents coverage of a meeting headlined by the Super Sprint from Newbury, plus racing from Market Rasen and The Curragh. With analysis from Leonna Mayor and Mick Fitzgerald, reports by Matt Chapman, Sally Ann Grassick and Luke Harvey, and commentary from Mark Johnson

programme.title: Tipping Point: Best Ever Finals
programme.desc: Two more of the most dramatic endgames from the arcade-themed quiz show hosted by Ben Shephard, in which the last contestant standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Toby Anstis, Paula Radcliffe, Rav Wilding and Vanessa Feltz pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: Shark! Celebrity Infested Waters
programme.desc: Lenny Henry, Lucy Punch, Helen George, Rachel Riley, Ade Adepitan, Dougie Poynter and Ross Noble head to the Bahamas to swim with man-eating sharks. Experts Danni Washington and Tristan Guttridge and shark attack survivor Paul de Gelder are the mentors whose mission is to help the celebrities conquer their fears and teach them to love this notorious predator

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: UEFA Women's Euro 2025
programme.desc: France v Germany (Kick-off 8.00pm). All the action from the fourth and concluding quarter-final, held at St. Jakob-Park in Basel, Switzerland. France finished top of Group D after winning all three of their group matches, including a 2-1 victory over holders England. Their opponents finished second in Group C after defeating Poland and Denmark, but suffering a 4-1 defeat at the hands of table-toppers Sweden last time out

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Suspicion
programme.desc: Hiding in a country cottage, the five suspects attempt to uncover who framed them-or who among them is guilty.

programme.title: Tour de France Highlights
programme.desc: Action from stage 14, which consisted of a 182.6km route from Pau to the ski resort of Luchon-Superbagnres. Gary Imlach presents, with analysis from Pete Kennaugh, commentary by Ned Boulting and David Millar, and interviews from reporters Daniel Friebe and Matt Rendell

programme.title: The Twelve
programme.desc: As the jury is selected for Kate Lawson's lengthy trial, the Press follows the sensational case of her missing 14-year-old niece Claire Spears, who is presumed murdered. When the jurors meet for the first time, it's clear that this is a diverse group who bring their own problems to the table. Australian courtroom drama, starring Sam Neill and Kate Mulvany

programme.title: Flushed Away
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure featuring the voices of Hugh Jackman, Kate Winslet and Ian McKellen. Posh rodent Roddy St James leads a sheltered life in a Kensington mansion, with his every need catered for by his wealthy owners. But his life as a pampered pet comes to an end when he's flushed down the toilet to a subterranean world where the population is being threatened by an evil toad.

programme.desc: Katie is joined by Steps' Lee Latchford-Evans to make a mini allotment, hairdresser Michael Douglas and make-up artist Genevieve Turley transform a supportive sister, and JJ Goodman serves up more delicious drinks

programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Joining Alan to provide the chat this time are Selina Scott, Pixie Lott and Tom Parker-Bowles, and we also meet some rare-breed Guernsey goats with a royal title.

programme.title: Ninja Warrior UK
programme.desc: Competitors from across the nation test their strength, speed and courage in this obstacle-course challenge, with celebrity contestants including professional skater Sylvain Longchambon, singer Joe McElderry, and Olympian snowboarder Aimee Fuller competing alongside members of the public. Hosted by Ben Shephard, Rochelle Humes and Chris Kamara

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Mrs Doubtfire
programme.desc: Comedy drama starring Robin Williams, Sally Field and Pierce Brosnan. When voiceover artist Daniel Hillard walks out of his day job, his wife Miranda decides it's time to walk out on him, and is granted custody of their children. Daniel is desperate to be with his kids, so when Miranda advertises for a nanny-cum-housekeeper he applies for the job in disguise.

programme.title: The Spy Who Loved Me
programme.desc: Spy adventure starring Roger Moore and Barbara Bach. James Bond sets out to stop an evil shipping magnate who is capturing nuclear submarines by means of a secret tracking device. Bond finds help in the unlikely shape of a beautiful KGB agent, and a formidable enemy in steel-toothed killer Jaws.

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Joining Alan to provide the chat this time are Selina Scott, Pixie Lott and Tom Parker-Bowles, and we also meet some rare-breed Guernsey goats with a royal title.

programme.title: Ninja Warrior UK
programme.desc: Competitors from across the nation test their strength, speed and courage in this obstacle-course challenge, with celebrity contestants including professional skater Sylvain Longchambon, singer Joe McElderry, and Olympian snowboarder Aimee Fuller competing alongside members of the public. Hosted by Ben Shephard, Rochelle Humes and Chris Kamara

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Mrs Doubtfire
programme.desc: Comedy drama starring Robin Williams, Sally Field and Pierce Brosnan. When voiceover artist Daniel Hillard walks out of his day job, his wife Miranda decides it's time to walk out on him, and is granted custody of their children. Daniel is desperate to be with his kids, so when Miranda advertises for a nanny-cum-housekeeper he applies for the job in disguise.

programme.title: The Spy Who Loved Me
programme.desc: Spy adventure starring Roger Moore and Barbara Bach. James Bond sets out to stop an evil shipping magnate who is capturing nuclear submarines by means of a secret tracking device. Bond finds help in the unlikely shape of a beautiful KGB agent, and a formidable enemy in steel-toothed killer Jaws.

programme.title: Sean's Scotland
programme.desc: Sean travels to Perth and Kinross, visiting Loch of the Lowes Visitor Centre and Wildlife Reserve to learn about the ospreys that return there to mate

programme.title: The People's History Show
programme.desc: There is a visit to Dounreay nuclear power plant, Atta Yaqub learns about footballer-turned-writer Neil Paterson, and Jennifer Reoch finds out about the thread industry in Paisley

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Celebrity Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts as contestants Mark Bonnar, Alexandra Burke and Claire Sweeney 'see it and say it' as they try to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. After the first elimination, the two remaining players battle to reach the Super Catchphrase round, where one of them could win 50,000 for the charity of their choice

programme.title: Karen Pirie
programme.desc: Amid societal unrest in 1984, oil heiress Catriona Grant and her son Adam are kidnapped at gunpoint, but after sending two ransom notes the culprits unexpectedly fall silent and the pair are never seen again. When a man's body is discovered 40 years later in a quarry with a piece of evidence connected to the case, DI Karen Pirie is tasked with reopening the case with the first new lead in decades. Return of the crime drama based on the series of novels by Val McDermid, starring Lauren Lyle

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Breaking the Silence: Kate's Story
programme.desc: Former MP Kate Kniveton gives a frank and full insight into her experience of being abused and shamed into silence over 10 years by her ex-husband Andrew Griffiths, who was then a Conservative government minister. Kate also meets other high-achieving professional women who were secretly suffering appalling abuse behind closed doors and who, like her, felt there was no way they could escape the relationship. In this powerful documentary for the Exposure strand, Kate also sheds new light on the secretive world of the family court and shows how perpetrators can play the system to continue their abuse and how judges can get it badly wrong when it comes to protecting survivors and their children

programme.title: The Assembly
programme.desc: Footballer-turned-presenter Gary Lineker gets the grilling of a lifetime as he faces questions from autistic and learning-disabled interviewers, asking if he was forced out by the BBC and who the worst person he has worked with is. From the Hand of God to his first love, no question is off the table and no subject out of bounds when it comes to the Assembly's line of enquiry - expect revelations, chaos, and a lot of laughs

programme.desc: Richard John Neil presents action from Snetterton featuring racing from the Wera Tools F4 British Championship and The Vertu MINI CHALLENGE.

programme.title: Lingo

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Mario from Ipswich, Emma originally from Barnsley, Jacqueline from Surrey and Greg from Nottingham pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Liam makes a discovery. while Robert's suspicions are piqued and Pollard tells Mack the truth

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Ryan worries about Debbie's behaviour at work, Dev absolves Aadi of any guilt for the robbery, Lou asks a massive favour of Sally, and Billy overhears Theo lying to an old friend

programme.title: Shark! Celebrity Infested Waters
programme.desc: The famous faces discover their final mission will be to swim with 18-foot tiger sharks. Ade Adepitan struggles to master his special diving equipment during a training exercise and makes a mad dash for a boat with sharks all around him. Meanwhile, Lucy Punch and Ross Noble find themselves in 'predator alley', Helen George suffers a panic attack and falls behind the team during scuba training, and the stars enjoy a spectacular coral reef dive before learning about their next encounter

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Yorkshire Ripper: The Secret Murders
programme.desc: Part one of two. Examining the police investigation into the crimes of serial killer Peter Sutcliffe, known as the Yorkshire Ripper, and the missed opportunities to charge him for his earlier, unacknowledged crimes. This episode explores the murders of Judith Roberts in 1972 and Carol Wilkinson in 1977, and the two innocent men who were mistakenly charged with their killings

programme.title: Tour de France Highlights
programme.desc: Gary Imlach presents news on the second rest day, featuring a recap of the action so far and a look ahead to forthcoming stages. With features from reporters Daniel Friebe and Matt Rendell and insight from Pete Kennaugh

programme.title: Creed II
programme.desc: Boxing drama starring Michael B Jordan and Sylvester Stallone. Three years after he began training with the legendary Rocky Balboa, Adonis "Donnie" Creed has taken the title of world heavyweight champion. When Russian fighter Viktor Drago, whose father Ivan killed Donnie's dad in the ring decades prior, challenges the young American to a show bout, Donnie and Rocky find their relationship strained. Can the pair work things out? And can Donnie find the inner strength to avenge his father?

programme.title: Tour de France Highlights
programme.desc: Action from the 13th stage, a 10.9km individual time-trial from Loudenvielle to Peyragudes. Gary Imlach presents, with analysis from Pete Kennaugh, commentary by Ned Boulting and David Millar, and interviews from reporters Daniel Friebe and Matt Rendell

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Katie Piper's Weekend Escape
programme.desc: Katie is joined by Steps' Lee Latchford-Evans to make a mini allotment, hairdresser Michael Douglas and make-up artist Genevieve Turley transform another charity founder, and JJ Goodman serves up more delicious drinks

programme.title: Ainsley's Food We Love
programme.desc: The chef prepares a selection of dishes perfect for al fresco dining, including Cypriot lamb chops, cherry tomato skewers and potato salad. Supper Club host Joseph Denison Carey serves up a tagliatelle, and Ainsley shows guest Dev Griffin how to make sesame and singer seabass with an Asian noodles salad. Olly Smith has canned drinks perfect for the great outdoors

programme.title: Tomorrow Never Dies
programme.desc: Spy adventure starring Pierce Brosnan, Jonathan Pryce and Michelle Yeoh. Intending to reap the profits of increased ratings for his global multimedia empire, Elliot Carver attempts to ignite a conflict between Britain and China by sinking a British frigate and shooting down a Chinese fighter plane. The British Secret Service sends James Bond to verify suspicions that Carver is behind the incident.

programme.title: Jimmy & Shivi's Farmhouse Breakfast
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty and Shivi Ramoutar's guest is singer Chesney Hawkes, with Shivi serving up smashed breakfast tacos and drinks expert Andy Clarke joins the gang for a tequila tasting. Jimmy checks in on the snakes at the wildlife park to make sure that they're growing properly, and Max McMurdo makes a handy bread-slicing device

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is joined at his Hampshire home this time by singer-songwriter Jack Savoretti, Midsomer Murders star Neil Dudgeon, and chefs Glynn Purnell and Sabrina Gidda.

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: John Torode and Lisa Faulkner make four mouth-watering dishes with only five main ingredients, starting with a garlic and rosemary focaccia, followed by John's pink spaghetti. Following that are chicken and peanut butter scissor-cut noodles and moreish and fuss-free banana doughnuts.

programme.title: Raymond Blanc's Royal Kitchen Gardens
programme.desc: The chef returns to Highgrove House in Gloucestershire, the family residence of King Charles and Queen Camilla. Mel takes him around some of their vegetable beds while chatting about how she came to be a gardener for the King, while royal beekeeper Stephen demonstrates the art of managing hives as he and Raymond discuss their shared passion for bees and honey

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: STV Racing: Live from Newbury
programme.desc: Oli Bell presents coverage of a meeting headlined by the Super Sprint from Newbury, plus racing from Market Rasen and The Curragh. With analysis from Leonna Mayor and Mick Fitzgerald, reports by Matt Chapman, Sally Ann Grassick and Luke Harvey, and commentary from Mark Johnson

programme.title: Tipping Point: Best Ever Finals
programme.desc: Two more of the most dramatic endgames from the arcade-themed quiz show hosted by Ben Shephard, in which the last contestant standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Toby Anstis, Paula Radcliffe, Rav Wilding and Vanessa Feltz pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: Shark! Celebrity Infested Waters
programme.desc: Lenny Henry, Lucy Punch, Helen George, Rachel Riley, Ade Adepitan, Dougie Poynter and Ross Noble head to the Bahamas to swim with man-eating sharks. Experts Danni Washington and Tristan Guttridge and shark attack survivor Paul de Gelder are the mentors whose mission is to help the celebrities conquer their fears and teach them to love this notorious predator

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: UEFA Women's Euro 2025
programme.desc: France v Germany (Kick-off 8.00pm). All the action from the fourth and concluding quarter-final, held at St. Jakob-Park in Basel, Switzerland. France finished top of Group D after winning all three of their group matches, including a 2-1 victory over holders England. Their opponents finished second in Group C after defeating Poland and Denmark, but suffering a 4-1 defeat at the hands of table-toppers Sweden last time out

programme.title: Suspicion
